availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Norvell (Carlisle, Kentucky, KY Rep, judge and attorney)

body.p: Carlisle, Kentucky, politician, judge and attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Emily G. Summers Norvell in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on March 15, 1836. Father of Lucy S. Norvell, Joseph Norvell, John Norvell, Jenny P. Norvell, Alice R. Norvell, and Mattie E. Norvell. Member of the Kentucky legislature from Nicholas County from 1833 to 1834. Attorney in Nicholas County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Nicholas County in 1850. Attorney and judge in Carlisle in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Nicholas County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas, District 2, p. 391A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas, District 2, p. 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas, Carlisle, p.137A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film #000252402, p. 149.
Find A Grave, "William Norvell (1803-1875)," Memorial 71831491, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/71831491 (accessed March 19, 2020).
The Biographical Encyclopaedia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century (Cincinnati, OH: J.M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 778.
